etymology.description: 䰜(䰜) (lì, "cauldron") + 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") = cooking rice in a cauldron -> congee
etymology.interpretation: The character 鬻(yù, "congee") visually represents rice being cooked in a cauldron, with steam depicted by two 弓(弓) (gōng) elements above, highlighting the process of making congee. It shows the preparation method through its components, illustrating the origin of the word 'congee'.

examples.chinese: 妈妈熬了一锅鬻(媽媽熬了一鍋鬻)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā áo le yī guō yù.
examples.english: Mom cooked up a pot of congee.

examples.chinese: 在寒冷的早晨(在寒冷的早晨)，一碗热鬻驱走了冬日的寒意(一碗熱鬻驅走了冬日的寒意)。
examples.pinyin: Zài hánlěng de zǎochén, yī wǎn rè yù qū zǒu le dōngrì de hányì.
examples.english: On a cold morning, a bowl of steaming congee chased away the chill of winter.
